description: Cannabis Spectral Analysis and Analytical Chemistry Questions covering chromatography, mass spectrometry, potency testing, and contaminate detection

categories.chromatography: HPLC, GC, and chromatographic method development
categories.contaminate_detection: Pesticides, heavy metals, and microbial testing
categories.method_validation: Analytical method development and validation protocols
categories.quality_control: Laboratory QC procedures and standard protocols
categories.regulatory_testing: Compliance testing and regulatory method requirements

difficulty_levels.beginner: Basic analytical concepts and standard testing procedures
difficulty_levels.intermediate: Method development and advanced analytical techniques
difficulty_levels.advanced: Complex analytical problems and method validation

questions.question: What HPLC conditions are optimal for cannabinoid separation and quantification?
questions.expected_answer: Use C18 column, acetonitrile/water mobile phase with formic acid, gradient elution, UV detection at 220nm and 280nm, 30-40°C column temperature, and 1.0 mL/min flow rate for optimal cannabinoid separation

questions.question: How do I develop a method for separating acidic and neutral cannabinoids simultaneously?
questions.expected_answer: Use pH-optimized mobile phases, consider derivatization for improved detection, employ gradient programming, select appropriate stationary phases, and validate peak identification using retention time and spectral data

questions.question: What MS/MS parameters should I use for cannabinoid identification and quantification?
questions.expected_answer: Use positive ESI mode, select appropriate precursor ions, optimize collision energies, choose specific product ions for SRM transitions, and validate with reference standards for accurate identification

questions.question: How do I perform untargeted metabolomics analysis of cannabis extracts?
questions.expected_answer: Use high-resolution MS, employ both positive and negative ionization, implement data-dependent acquisition, utilize metabolomics databases, perform statistical analysis, and validate identified compounds

questions.question: What are the requirements for potency testing in {{state}} cannabis laboratories?
questions.expected_answer: Requirements include analysis of major cannabinoids (THC, CBD, CBG, CBN), reporting limits, method validation, proficiency testing, and compliance with {{state}} regulatory testing protocols

questions.question: How do I validate a potency testing method for cannabis-infused products?
questions.expected_answer: Perform accuracy studies, precision testing, linearity assessment, limit of detection/quantification, specificity evaluation, robustness testing, and matrix effect studies for various product matrices

questions.question: What pesticides are commonly tested in cannabis and what analytical methods are used?
questions.expected_answer: Common pesticides include organophosphates, carbamates, pyrethroids, and neonicotinoids. Use LC-MS/MS and GC-MS/MS methods with QuEChERS extraction and appropriate internal standards for quantification

questions.question: How do I develop a comprehensive screening method for mycotoxins in cannabis?
questions.expected_answer: Develop multi-mycotoxin LC-MS/MS method, optimize extraction procedures, validate for different matrices, include matrix-matched calibration, implement confirmatory testing, and establish appropriate limits

questions.question: What GC-MS conditions are best for terpene profiling in cannabis?
questions.expected_answer: Use capillary column (DB-5 or equivalent), splitless injection, temperature programming from 40-250°C, helium carrier gas, EI ionization, and authentic standards for identification and quantification

questions.question: How do I quantify volatile and semi-volatile terpenes simultaneously?
questions.expected_answer: Use dual-column GC system or comprehensive GCxGC, optimize sample preparation to minimize losses, employ multiple internal standards, validate retention time windows, and account for thermal degradation

questions.question: What parameters must be validated for a new cannabis testing method?
questions.expected_answer: Validate accuracy, precision, linearity, range, specificity, limit of detection, limit of quantification, robustness, and stability according to ICH guidelines and regulatory requirements

questions.question: How do I perform method validation for cannabis testing across different product matrices?
questions.expected_answer: Conduct matrix-specific validation studies, assess matrix effects, perform recovery studies, establish matrix-matched calibrations, validate for each product type, and document method applicability

questions.question: What quality control procedures are required for cannabis testing laboratories in {{state}}?
questions.expected_answer: Implement control charts, reference standards, proficiency testing, duplicate analysis, blank samples, spike recoveries, and compliance with {{state}} laboratory certification requirements

questions.question: How do I establish a comprehensive LIMS system for cannabis testing laboratory?
questions.expected_answer: Implement sample tracking, chain of custody, automated calculations, trending analysis, instrument integration, data integrity controls, regulatory reporting, and audit trail functionality

questions.question: What extraction methods are most effective for cannabinoid analysis?
questions.expected_answer: Use sonication with ethanol or methanol, liquid-liquid extraction, solid-phase extraction for cleanup, consider matrix-specific approaches, and optimize for different product types and analytes

questions.question: How do I optimize sample preparation for multi-residue pesticide analysis in cannabis?
questions.expected_answer: Implement QuEChERS methodology, optimize extraction solvents, use dispersive SPE cleanup, consider matrix-matched standards, validate recovery across pesticide classes, and minimize matrix interferences
